o:CustomCheckTargetItem.a:Name: Shortcut is broken (MDDE)
o:CustomCheckTargetItem.a:Comment: The model check, checks whether the current shortcut is broken.
o:CustomCheckTargetItem.a:HelpMessage:
The model check, checks whether the current shortcut is broken. Meaning it cannot find the object it points to. In PowerDesigner the Shortcut has the status 'Not Found' when this is the case.
You can re-map the shortcut to the object is should point to by opening the shortcut and select 'Change Target Object'.
o:CustomCheckTargetItem.a:CheckScript: Function %Check%(obj) %Check% = True ' If the status of a shortcut is 'Not Found', then it's broken. If obj.Status = "Not Found" Then %Check% = False End If End Function
o:CustomCheckTargetItem.a:AutoFixScrpt:
Function %Fix%(obj, outmsg) ' Implement your automatic correction on <obj> here ' filling <outmsg> as you wish ' and return True if successful.
outmsg = "Automatic correction not implemented"
%Fix% = False End Function
